verses.roman:
taṁ tathāyāntam ālokya
gadām ādāya satvaraḥ
avaplutya rathāt kṛṣṇaḥ
sindhuṁ veleva pratyadhāt

synonyms: tam—him; tathā—in this way; āyāntam—approaching; ālokya—seeing; gadām—His club; ādāya—taking; satvaraḥ—quickly; avaplutya—leaping down; rathāt—from His chariot; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; sindhum—the sea; velā—the shore; iva—as; pratyadhāt—checked.
translation: Seeing Dantavakra approach, Lord Kṛṣṇa quickly picked up His club, jumped down from His chariot and stopped His advancing opponent just as the shore holds back the ocean.

purport.content: Śrīla Prabhupāda writes, "When Kṛṣṇa appeared before Dantavakra, his heroic march was immediately stopped, just as the great furious waves of the ocean are stopped by the beach."
